title: pretty print during tracing macros

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
It would be nice if rust considered syntax structure while printing macros during logging and tracing.

```
# Current output of log_syntax!:
struct => PRIV struct Params [ @ app test ::std::string::ParseError ] [
subcommands => {  } params => {
( PRIV quiet QUIET bool { q } {  } { flag } ) (
PRIV verbose VERBOSE bool { v } {  } { flag } ) (
PRIV cfg CFG String { c } {  } { default String::from("") } ) (
PRIV path PATH String { p } {  } { required } ) (
PRIV foo FOO Option<String> {  } { foo } { optional } ) (
PRIV n N Option<u32> { n } {  } { option map (|v: Option<&str>| v.map(|_| 3))
} ) ( PRIV x X u32 { x } {  } { map (|v| 4) } ) } ]
```
```
# Pretty output
struct => PRIV struct Params [ @ app test ::std::string::ParseError ]
[
    subcommands => {  }
    params => {
        ( PRIV quiet QUIET bool { q } {  } { flag } )
        ( PRIV verbose VERBOSE bool { v } {  } { flag } )
        ( PRIV cfg CFG String { c } {  } { default String::from("") } )
        ( PRIV path PATH String { p } {  } { required } )
        ( PRIV foo FOO Option<String> {  } { foo } { optional } )
        ( PRIV n N Option<u32> { n } {  } {
            option map (|v: Option<&str>| v.map(|_| 3))
        } )
        ( PRIV x X u32 { x } {  } { map (|v| 4) } )
    }
]
```
